definition: to choose/to accept or reject
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch
residence
old variant of 捨|舍[she3]
surname She
to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: One big difference is man's attitude toward the seperation of sex and love.
sentences.chinese: 其中一个取舍的结果，就是性与爱的分离。

sentences.english: In this critical time of a toss-up, she will be where to go?
sentences.chinese: 在这难以取舍的关键时刻，她将何去何从？

sentences.english: TV fans may have tough choicesin new season.
sentences.chinese: 新剧季到来，电视迷们可能要难做取舍了。

sentences.english: How do we calculate these kind of trade-offs?
sentences.chinese: 我们怎么来计算这样的取舍呢？

sentences.english: How should we choose between these two views?
sentences.chinese: 我们该如何在两个理论之间取舍？

sentences.english: The fourth problem is whether to keep elimination regulation.
sentences.chinese: 第四个问题是涤除权制度取舍。

sentences.english: I feel like I have to choose between my personal life and my career.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉自己必须在个人生活和事业之间做出取舍。

sentences.english: And I-I can't decide between the two of them.
sentences.chinese: 而我无法在这两个女孩中取舍。

sentences.english: It depends on what your views are about freedom versus societal level benefits.
sentences.chinese: 这取决于你如何看待自由和社会层面利益之间的取舍。

sentences.english: Really, how can you pick one Bront? over the other?
sentences.chinese: 说实在的，你怎么能在两个勃朗特间作取舍呢？

sentences.english: As a reader, you face trade-offs with both.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个读者，你得做出取舍。

sentences.english: No trade-off between increases in living standards and population size.
sentences.chinese: 不再需要在生活水准与人口之间取舍。

sentences.english: These would be perfectly valid reasons to choose one software platform over another.
sentences.chinese: 对于取舍一个软件平台这可能是完全有效的理由。

sentences.english: Take the trade-off between price and quality.
sentences.chinese: 以价格和品质间的取舍为例。

sentences.english: and I don't know, it's a trade off.
sentences.chinese: 我也不知道，这是种取舍。

sentences.english: And the terms of this trade-off depend on underlying conditions.
sentences.chinese: 取舍交易取决于基本条件。

definition: to choose (literary)
to consider/to weigh (a matter)/to balance (pros and cons)

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pinyin: yu2 yu3 xiong2 zhang3 bu4 ke3 jian1 de2

definition: to consider/to give serious consideration to sth/consideration
to weigh the pros and cons (idiom)

lit. the fish and the bear's paw, you can't have both at the same time (idiom, from Mencius); fig. you must choose one or the other/you can't always get everything you want/you can't have your cake and eat it
pros and cons/merits and drawbacks/advantages and disadvantages
to make a decision/resolution/decisiveness/resolute
dilemma/quandary/to face a difficult choice
gains and losses/success and failure/merits and demerits
to satisfy both sides/to accommodate both (demands)
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to reflect on/to ponder over
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to compromise/to reach terms/a compromise
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
